greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, A084938 * A165489 diagonalized as an infinite lower triangular matrix.
comment: A165490 is an eigentriangle (triangle A084938 * its shifted eigensequence), having two distinct properties: row sums = A165489, the eigensequence of triangle A084938: (1, 1, 2, 6, 23, 105, 550, 3236,...), and sum of row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Triangle read by rows, A084938 * its shifted eigensequence (1, 1, 1, 2, 6, 23,...) diagonalized as an infinite lower triangular matrix:
example: First few rows of the triangle =
Example: row 4 = (0, 6, 5, 6, 6) = termwise products of (0, 6, 5, 3, 1) and (1, 1, 1, 2, 6); where (0, 6, 5, 3, 1) = row 4 of triangle A084938.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 20 2009
